name: Word Search5 Quiz | Word Play | 25 Questions

questions.text: I ran away secretly with Penelope in order to marry her?
questions.explanation:
Elope & elope.

	penELOPE. Elope is to run away secretly with a lover especially in order to marry.

questions.text: Happy, pleased or contented to be in either the Everglades or Bangladesh?
questions.explanation:
Glad & glad.

	everGLADes or banGLADesh. Happy, pleased or contented is to be glad.

questions.text: Does this large spiral-horned antelope come from Ireland?
questions.explanation:
Eland & eland.

	irELAND. Eland is the large spiral-horned antelope.

questions.text: The medicine man designs a place for the exhibition of films?
questions.explanation:
Cinema & cinema.

	mediCINE MAn. Cinema is a place designed for the exhibition of films.

questions.text: Informed of current developments in Dover, the capital of Delaware?
questions.explanation:
Aware & aware.

	delAWARE. To be aware is to be informed of current developments.

questions.text: I can't believe Sandra Bullock is dull, dingy or shabby?
questions.explanation:
Drab & drab.

	sanDRA Bullock. Drab is to be dull, dingy or shabby.

questions.text: In communications, the code word for the letter 'e' is found at Lake Okeechobee in the Everglades?
questions.explanation:
Echo & echo.

	okeECHObee. In communications the code name for the letter 'e' is echo.

questions.text: Any monstrous or cruel person does not like progress?
questions.explanation:
Ogre & ogre.

	prOGREss. An ogre can be any monstrous or cruel person.

questions.text: You will find the American alligator at the artificial waterway constructed for navigation?
questions.explanation:
Canal & canal.

	ameriCAN ALligator. A canal is the artificial waterway constructed for navigation.

questions.text: Does keeping a mistress give you mental, emotional or physical strain?
questions.explanation:
Stress & stress.

	miSTRESS. Mental, emotional or physical strain can be caused by stress.

questions.text: This South American capital is found at Mount Kilimanjaro?
questions.explanation:
Lima & lima.

	kiLIMAnjaro. Lima is the capital of Peru in South America.

questions.text: This plant has white, blue, purple or pink daisy-like flowers and comes from Easter Island in the Pacific Ocean.
questions.explanation:
Aster & aster.

	eASTER. Aster is the plant with white, blue, purple or pink daisy-like flowers.

questions.text: You are always greeted enthusiastically in Thailand?
questions.explanation:
Hail & hail.

	tHAILand. Hail is to greet enthusiastically.

questions.text: The frigate sails to the Latvian capital?
questions.explanation:
Riga & riga.

	fRIGAte. Riga is the Latvian capital.

questions.text: It's another day in paradise for a large group of mammals living and feeding together?
questions.explanation:
Herd & herd.

	anotHER Day. A herd is a large group of mammals.

questions.text: The wife of one's uncle is having haunting experiences?
questions.explanation:
Aunt & aunt.

	hAUNTing. Aunt is the wife of one's uncle.

questions.text: Chinese porcelain is produced in Birmingham, the second largest city in Great Britain?
questions.explanation:
Ming & ming.

	birMINGham. Ming is the Chinese porcelain produced during the Ming Dynasty.

questions.text: A brook or stream can be very exciting even thrilling?
questions.explanation:
Rill & rill.

	thRILLing. A rill is the name of a brook or stream.

questions.text: Only Zorba the Greek would swim or paddle in a body of open water especially for pleasure?
questions.explanation:
Bathe & bathe.

	zorBA THE. To bathe is to swim or paddle in a body of open water especially for pleasure.

questions.text: It's a struggle to construct a long, wooden, shallow basket to be used for carrying flowers or fruit?
questions.explanation:
Trug & trug.

	sTRUGgle. A trug is a long, shallow basket used to carry fruit or flowers.

questions.text: This Irish female vocalist is found in Mount Kenya National Park with 'Orinoco Flow'?
questions.explanation:
Enya & enya.

	kENYA. Enya is the Irish vocalist whose hit was 'Orinoco Flow'.

questions.text: The gardener attends the forest featured in Shakespeare's 'As You Like It'?
questions.explanation:
Arden & arden.

	gARDENer. The Forest of Arden is a scene from Shakespeare's 'As You Like It'.

questions.text: This complex gelatinous carbohydrate is obtained from seaweed and Niagara Falls?
questions.explanation:
Agar & agar.

	niAGARa. Agar is the complex gelatinous carbohydrate obtained from seaweed.

questions.text: The snow leopard doesn't need to make a public statement or make an announcement of its whereabouts?
questions.explanation:
Ounce & ounce.

	annOUNCEment. The snow leopard is also called the ounce.

questions.text: It is common sense not to touch a poisonous snake?
questions.explanation:
Nous & nous & Ouch & ouch.

	poisoNOUS. Nous is British slang for common sense. Hope you enjoyed the word search. If you find any alternative answers like lains did in the last quiz, please let me know. Cheers. mmarron has suggested ouch for Q25. A great answer and has been added to the answer list.
